channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole, 5th February
item.description:
Massive deep pot hole
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlit skip, 5th February
item.description:
There has been a skip outside a neighbours house, 6 crossways road that has been in the road for around 6-10 months. The skip is unlit and close to a bus stop. Parking is very limited and is taking up valuable space. Unable to park outside our own home because the neighbour has numerous cars/building work going on, we are on a busy road with traffic going past all day and night including buses. We have small children and I feel this is causing an unnecessary risk and is affecting our daily life.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Crossways Road, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated dog fouling and when approached the "gentleman" just walked on., 5th February
item.description:
Brown and white springer spaniel came from area of Croft Close and Grant Close maybe Boevey Path on a lead. I believe this dog owner is responsible for the mess in and around that area. When confronted and offered a bag he walked on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harold Avenue, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds & some fly tipping at bottom of alleyway near no.14 & 15., 5th February
item.description:
Weeds & some fly tipping right at the bottom of alleyway, near no.14 & 15 Nightingale Corner, St Mary Cray, BR5 3PS. Bottom half of this alleyway is owned by LBB. Please cut tge weeds & clear the fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Wotton Green, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cobblestones are loose, blister paving is damaged, paving slabs are severely cracked, 5th February
item.description:
All of these paving slabs and cobbles have been getting progressively worse for at least two years now. The cobblestones have loosened and are pronounced and are hazzardous to walkers. The blishter paving slabs are deteriorating and pieces are coming out. These are meant to be an aid for blind people. This damage was sustained (I believe) when heavy trucks were delivering items during construction works to buildings on Emerson Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Wotton Green, St Mary Cray, Greater London

item.title: Unknown green waste bin, filled with rainwater and rubbish, 5th February
item.description:
An additional green waste bin has appeared outside my home, next to my blue and green waste bin. it has filled up with rainwater and rubbish. it has been there for 6+ months. i am unable to dispose of it and would like it to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Ashmore Close, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Black bags from Village Agency by the tree ongoing, 5th February
item.description:
Ongoing issue with Village agency at 25 Downham Rd with black rubbish bins left by the nearby trees, numerous occasions plenty of evidence with address inside. As a business they should have Waste removal arranged. They keep leaving black bags out.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Bus stop rubbish bin on Oxhawth Crescent West and East, 5th February
item.description:
Why are there no Bus stop rubbish bins on Oxhawth Crescent West and East ? These stops are covered in litter exactly because a proper bin is not installed and there is nowhere to put litter. Please install proper waste bins like on other stops in Petts Wood and Bromley, thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Street litter needs clearing on Southborough Lane and Frankswood Avenue, 5th February
item.description:
Street litter needs clearing on Southborough Lane and Frankswood Avenue. There is broken glass (near the bus stops), plastic bottles, paper packaging and cardboard scattered around on grassed areas and pavement. Previous reports have not been actioned by the contractor, but closed without a proper action. Come on Bromley council, please supervise your contractors and demand action! Those little pavement sweeper vehicles are useless, they leave more rubbish behind and clean only a narrow stretch of the pavement. Contractor should REGULARLY send manual waste-pickers (contractor staff) that clean properly the grassed areas and wide pavement areas all along Southborough Lane and Frankswood Avenue. And responsible Bromley Council people should visit and check that the work is actually done! Otherwise you encourage contractor inaction and waste our council taxpayer money... Thank you for acting properly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park Fencing has been Broken, 5th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Hill, Goddington, Greater London
